item.title: BitTorrent unveils new live-streaming platform for peer-to-peer broadcasts
item.description:
BitTorrent unveils new live-streaming platform for peer-to-peer broadcasts

BitTorrent has been working on its proprietary live-streaming technology for years, but today unveiled its first dedicated app. BitTorrent Live is scheduled to launch on Apple TV this week, before coming to iOS and Android sometime in June.

item.title: Can one product really contain everything the body needs? - disinformation
item.description:
Can one product really contain everything the body needs? - disinformation

Powdered plant based foods claiming to contain everything the body needs are hitting the market, and if the companies behind them have their way you'll soon be mixing up your nutritionally compete matrix style gruel for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

item.title: 'Apocalypse' Pow: The New 'X-Men' Makes the Comic-Book Movie Great Again
item.description:
'Apocalypse' Pow: The New 'X-Men' Makes the Comic-Book Movie Great Again

There's a scene during the first half of Bryan Singer's X-Men: Apocalypse that is so emotionally resonant, so well-put-together, and so quiet that you might briefly forget you're watching a superhero film. It involves a raid by some Polish officers in the remote forest where Erik Lehnsherr, a/k/a Magneto (Michael...

item.title: Whistleblowers Confirm Facebook Censors Certain Types of News Stories - disinformation
item.description:
Whistleblowers Confirm Facebook Censors Certain Types of News Stories - disinformation

Former Facebook employees who managed the "Trending News" section of the site are accusing the behemoth social media platform of censoring news stories and "injecting" others to artificially inflate their popularity. Unsurprisingly, in light of these accusations, the developing story appears to have been censored from the site's list of popular stories, underscoring deeply-rooted problems in the way information is presented online.

item.title: Wendy's Replacing Workers With Kiosks In Response to 'Fight For $15'
item.description:
Wendy's Replacing Workers With Kiosks In Response to 'Fight For $15'

The fast food chain announced it will start automating all of its restaurants by installing self-serve kiosks in 6,000 locations by the end of the year. Although McDonalds has already been experimenting with kiosks, Wendy's announcement is the largest roll-out to date and will likely spark a trend leading to fully robotic restaurants.

item.title: House Hides Most War Funding in NDAA Bill Scheme
item.description:
House Hides Most War Funding in NDAA Bill Scheme

May 11, 2016   |   admintam The House Appropriations Committee has today unveiled its draft version of the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA), a $575 billion bill that includes some $59 billion worth of money for Overseas Contingency Operations (OCO), the controversial fund which the Pentagon is allowed to shuffle around.

item.title: The Kepler Mission Has Found Another 1,284 Planets-The Biggest Haul Yet
item.description:
The Kepler Mission Has Found Another 1,284 Planets-The Biggest Haul Yet

NASA's Kepler space telescope, which has been taking a galactic census, just verified a whopping 1,284 new planets-the most ever announced in one go, scientists said on Tuesday. This planetary bounty more than doubles the number of confirmed planets that Kepler has already found, and some of them are thought to be Earthlike.

item.title: Here's What Happens to A Kid's Body After Cutting Sugar for Just 10 Days
item.description:
Here's What Happens to A Kid's Body After Cutting Sugar for Just 10 Days

May 7, 2016   |   admintam (NATURALSOCIETY) Although it may sound like a bad infomercial, a study financed by the National Institutes of Health has shown that cutting added sugar in children's diets can improve their overall health incredibly quickly.
